name: The Fool
archetype: Puer Aeternus (Eternal Youth), The Hero, The Trickster, The Self (in potential)
psychological_role: Represents the beginning of the individuation journey
ego_status: Pre-ego or undeveloped ego—innocent, open, and unaware of the unconscious
symbolic_number: 0 — infinite potential, nothingness and wholeness, symbol of the Self before differentiation
shadow_aspect: Irresponsibility, escapism, fear of maturity or structure
spiritual_meaning: Leap of faith, surrender to the unknown, trust in life’s unfolding
unconscious_connection: Embodies the unconscious psyche before integration begins
journey_theme: The raw, unshaped energy that moves into the world to discover itself
jungian_goal: Transformation through experience; development of ego, shadow, anima/animus, and ultimately the Self

name: The Magician
archetype: The Ego, The Alchemist, The Magus, The Trickster (Light Side)
psychological_role: Represents the emergence of conscious awareness, willpower, and intentionality
ego_status: Developing ego—aware of personal power and the ability to shape reality
symbolic_number: 1 — individuality, conscious choice, unity of intention
shadow_aspect: Manipulation, illusion, ego inflation, misuse of power
spiritual_meaning: Mastery of the elements of consciousness (mind, body, emotions, spirit)
unconscious_connection: Bridging the unconscious (tools on the table) with conscious will (raised wand)
journey_theme: The first conscious step toward individuation—learning to act with awareness
jungian_goal: Integration of conscious intention with unconscious forces for creative manifestation

name: The High Priestess
archetype: The Anima, The Wise Woman, The Oracle, The Unconscious, The Moon
psychological_role: Represents the deep unconscious, inner wisdom, intuition, and mysteries beyond the ego
ego_status: The ego encounters the mystery of the unconscious—begins to sense its depth and power
symbolic_number: 2 — duality, polarity, the tension between opposites (conscious/unconscious, light/dark)
shadow_aspect: Repression, secrecy, illusion, emotional detachment, fear of the unknown
spiritual_meaning: Access to hidden knowledge through introspection, dreams, intuition, and silence
unconscious_connection: She is the unconscious—guardian of inner truths and the threshold to deeper Self
journey_theme: The seeker is called to look inward, to pause, and to trust the inner voice
jungian_goal: Integration of the anima, recognition of the unconscious as a source of insight and power

name: The Empress
archetype: The Great Mother, The Earth Goddess, The Nurturer, The Creative Feminine
psychological_role: Embodiment of the fertile, nurturing aspect of the unconscious and the creative principle
ego_status: The ego begins to integrate emotional grounding and connection to the body and nature
symbolic_number: 3 — creativity, growth, abundance, synthesis of opposites into new form
shadow_aspect: Smothering love, dependency, overindulgence, or obsession with material comfort
spiritual_meaning: Union with the Earth and the divine feminine; a celebration of life, beauty, and abundance
unconscious_connection: Represents the nourishing, life-giving aspect of the unconscious that supports growth
journey_theme: Learning to receive, to connect with sensuality and creativity, and to trust the cycles
jungian_goal: Embrace of the Great Mother within, finding inner safety, and learning to self-nurture

name: The Emperor
archetype: The Father, The King, The Ruler, The Lawgiver, The Patriarchal Self
psychological_role: Represents the development of structure, order, authority, and the disciplined ego
ego_status: The ego strengthens—learning to assert itself and bring form and control to experience
symbolic_number: 4 — stability, foundation, boundaries, material mastery
shadow_aspect: Tyranny, rigidity, control issues, authoritarianism, emotional suppression
spiritual_meaning: Establishing inner order, leadership, and responsibility; connection to divine authority
unconscious_connection: The unconscious drive to create systems, rules, and identity in the external world
journey_theme: The seeker develops personal sovereignty, boundaries, and a secure ego-identity
jungian_goal: Healthy integration of the Father archetype—self-governance, responsibility, and purpose

name: The Hierophant
archetype: The Wise Old Man, The Priest, The Teacher, The Superego, The Gatekeeper of Tradition
psychological_role: Represents the internalization of cultural norms, spiritual authority, and inherited belief systems
ego_status: The ego is shaped by external teachings and collective traditions
symbolic_number: 5 — challenge, learning, growth through tension, bridging opposites
shadow_aspect: Dogmatism, blind conformity, repression of individuality, moral rigidity
spiritual_meaning: Connecting with spiritual tradition, sacred knowledge, and the wisdom of the collective psyche
unconscious_connection: Symbol of the collective unconscious speaking through institutions, ritual, and inherited knowledge
journey_theme: The seeker confronts and evaluates their belief systems, values, and inherited truths
jungian_goal: Conscious individuation from external authority—integrating tradition without losing authenticity

name: The Lovers
archetype: The Union of Opposites, Anima/Animus, The Choice, Sacred Marriage (Hieros Gamos)
psychological_role: Represents the confrontation with duality, the call to choose and integrate inner opposites
ego_status: The ego begins to perceive relationships as mirrors of the inner psyche, leading to self-awareness
symbolic_number: 6 — harmony, balance, integration, relationship
shadow_aspect: Projection, idealization, fear of intimacy, fragmentation of self, dependence
spiritual_meaning: Love as a spiritual path; the merging of inner masculine and feminine archetypes
unconscious_connection: The unconscious draws us into relationship for the purpose of growth and integration
journey_theme: The seeker must make a meaningful choice, often between outer appearance and inner truth
jungian_goal: Integration of the anima/animus (opposite gender aspect of the psyche); authentic connection

name: The Chariot
archetype: The Hero, The Will, The Ego in Motion, The Warrior, The Persona
psychological_role: Represents the ego asserting control, developing confidence, direction, and purpose
ego_status: A strong, outward-facing ego begins to emerge, focused on goal-setting and mastery
symbolic_number: 7 — struggle, initiation, evolution, spiritual testing
shadow_aspect: Arrogance, ego inflation, lack of emotional integration, control obsession
spiritual_meaning: Victory through self-discipline, alignment of inner drives (the two sphinxes/forces)
unconscious_connection: The Chariot’s power comes from integrating opposing unconscious drives and guiding them consciously
journey_theme: Mastery over inner conflict; moving forward with willpower and purpose
jungian_goal: Development of a balanced ego—one that directs rather than represses the unconscious

name: Strength
archetype: The Tamer of the Beast, Inner Strength, The Integration of Instinct, Compassionate Warrior
psychological_role: Represents the conscious ego learning to befriend and integrate the instinctual or shadow self
ego_status: The ego moves from external control (The Chariot) to inner mastery through gentleness and courage
symbolic_number: 8 — power, regeneration, rhythm, karma, the eternal loop (∞ symbol often shown)
shadow_aspect: Repression of instinct, passive aggression, weakness disguised as virtue, or brute force
spiritual_meaning: True power comes from inner alignment, patience, and loving control—not domination
unconscious_connection: The lion symbolizes raw instinct or libido—not suppressed, but lovingly guided and honored
journey_theme: Learning to trust in quiet power, integrating the shadow with heart-centered awareness
jungian_goal: Individuation through integration—ego and instinct working in harmony, not opposition

name: The Hermit
archetype: The Wise Old Man, The Inner Guide, The Seeker, The Sage
psychological_role: Symbolizes withdrawal from external distraction to pursue inner wisdom and self-knowledge
ego_status: The ego begins to willingly separate from worldly influence to commune with the Self
symbolic_number: 9 — completion of a cycle, introspection, preparation for transformation
shadow_aspect: Isolation, loneliness, withdrawal from life, cynicism, over-intellectualization
spiritual_meaning: Seeking illumination within, following the light of the Self through darkness and uncertainty
unconscious_connection: Represents a conscious journey into the depths of the unconscious, guided by inner light
journey_theme: Turning inward for answers; the quest for truth through solitude, silence, and contemplation
jungian_goal: Contact with the Self—the deep, inner center of wisdom that guides individuation

name: The Wheel of Fortune
archetype: The Wheel of Life, The Cycles of Fate, Karma, The Mandala, Synchronicity
psychological_role: Represents the turning of unconscious cycles, destiny, and the ever-shifting nature of the psyche
ego_status: The ego becomes aware of forces beyond its control—the dance between fate, chance, and inner alignment
symbolic_number: 10 — completion and renewal; a transition point between old identity and new awareness
shadow_aspect: Fatalism, chaos, externalization of power, clinging to control or certainty
spiritual_meaning: Trust in the larger pattern of life, seeing events as purposeful within the psyche’s evolution
unconscious_connection: The unconscious manifests through patterns, synchronicities, and cycles of growth and challenge
journey_theme: Encountering life’s rhythms and learning to surrender to transformation and mystery
jungian_goal: Realizing the Self works through cycles, not linear progress—embracing both light and shadow movement

name: Justice
archetype: The Judge, Karmic Balance, Moral Integrity, Discernment
psychological_role: Symbolizes accountability, discernment, and alignment of actions with inner truth
ego_status: The ego becomes capable of mature reflection and ethical self-examination
symbolic_number: 11 — a gateway, higher alignment, duality brought into balance
shadow_aspect: Harsh judgment, self-righteousness, denial of truth, or intellectual coldness
spiritual_meaning: The pursuit of truth, fairness, and karmic justice
unconscious_connection: Conscious evaluation of the unconscious motivations behind one's actions
journey_theme: A call to integrate personal responsibility and objective awareness
jungian_goal: Alignment of the ego with the inner judge or Self; ethical individuation

name: The Hanged Man
archetype: The Sacrificed One, The Mystic, The Initiate, Suspension
psychological_role: Represents surrender of ego control to allow deeper unconscious insight
ego_status: The ego is suspended—forced to pause, release, and reframe
symbolic_number: 12 — preparation for transformation through surrender
shadow_aspect: Stagnation, passivity, fear of change, victim consciousness
spiritual_meaning: Spiritual surrender and awakening through inversion of normal perspective
unconscious_connection: The unconscious speaks when the ego becomes still and open to new vision
journey_theme: Letting go of certainty to make room for transcendent understanding
jungian_goal: Ego humility; contact with transpersonal wisdom

name: Death
archetype: The Reaper, The Transformer, Ego Death, Endings and Beginnings
psychological_role: Symbolizes necessary transformation, the end of an identity or stage
ego_status: The ego must relinquish control and allow the old self to die
symbolic_number: 13 — profound change, initiation, rebirth
shadow_aspect: Fear of loss, clinging to identity, resistance to growth
spiritual_meaning: Rebirth through psychological and spiritual surrender
unconscious_connection: The unconscious facilitates death of outdated patterns to allow for new life
journey_theme: Shedding what no longer serves to make space for authenticity
jungian_goal: Acceptance of ego death as part of individuation

name: Temperance
archetype: The Alchemist, The Healer, The Mediator, Integration
psychological_role: Represents the integration of opposites and psychic harmony
ego_status: The ego learns balance, moderation, and trust in the process of healing
symbolic_number: 14 — transformation through harmony
shadow_aspect: Imbalance, avoidance of extremes, suppression of truth under false peace
spiritual_meaning: Alchemy of the soul—blending fire and water, body and spirit
unconscious_connection: Brings unconscious elements into balance with conscious awareness
journey_theme: A period of psychic realignment, subtle healing, and emotional maturity
jungian_goal: Inner reconciliation—union of opposites leads to individuation

name: The Devil
archetype: The Shadow, The Tempter, The Repressed Self, The Addict, The Saboteur
psychological_role: Represents the confrontation with the unconscious shadow, repressed desires, and internal bondage
ego_status: The ego is enslaved by unconscious drives—fear, shame, addiction, or denial
symbolic_number: 15 (1 + 5 = 6) — a distorted mirror of The Lovers; union corrupted by domination or illusion
shadow_aspect: Enslavement, self-deception, projection, fear of freedom, compulsions, and spiritual blindness
spiritual_meaning: Opportunity for radical liberation through confronting one’s inner darkness and false identities
unconscious_connection: The Devil is the raw power of the shadow—what we reject or fear in ourselves, now seeking integration
journey_theme: The seeker must reclaim power by facing what they avoid—including shame, lust, fear, or control
jungian_goal: Conscious integration of the shadow—turning chains of repression into tools for liberation and wholeness

name: The Tower
archetype: The Destroyer, The Crisis, The Awakener, The Shock of Revelation
psychological_role: Sudden collapse of the ego's false structures and defenses
ego_status: The ego is forcibly confronted with its limitations and illusions
symbolic_number: 16 — disruption, cleansing, divine intervention
shadow_aspect: Breakdown, denial, devastation, loss of control
spiritual_meaning: Sudden enlightenment or awakening through upheaval
unconscious_connection: The unconscious erupts to dismantle what no longer serves truth
journey_theme: Destruction as a necessary part of transformation and rebirth
jungian_goal: Liberation from false ego structures; the path to deeper truth

name: The Star
archetype: The Divine Spark, Hope, Inspiration, Healing Light
psychological_role: A return to hope and higher guidance after destruction
ego_status: The ego softens and begins to align with spiritual or intuitive renewal
symbolic_number: 17 — spiritual insight, restoration, soul-light
shadow_aspect: False hope, spiritual bypassing, disconnection from grounded reality
spiritual_meaning: Trust in the divine plan, guidance from the Higher Self
unconscious_connection: The unconscious provides healing symbols and visions of wholeness
journey_theme: Restoring inner faith and light; a spiritual beacon toward the Self
jungian_goal: Alignment with the transpersonal Self through inspiration and intuition

name: The Moon
archetype: The Shadow, Illusion, The Dream World, The Dark Feminine
psychological_role: Descent into the irrational, emotional, and unconscious realms
ego_status: The ego is disoriented—forced to face projection, confusion, and shadow
symbolic_number: 18 — deep insight, reflection, initiation into mystery
shadow_aspect: Delusion, fear, paranoia, emotional overwhelm
spiritual_meaning: Navigating the unconscious through dream, intuition, and inner myth
unconscious_connection: The realm of deep shadow, archetypal symbols, and emotional truths
journey_theme: A night journey through uncertainty; confronting the inner labyrinth
jungian_goal: Encounter and integration of the shadow

name: The Sun
archetype: The Divine Child, Conscious Clarity, Joyful Integration
psychological_role: Represents illumination, joy, and the conscious Self emerging whole
ego_status: The ego shines in unity with the Self—clear, joyful, empowered
symbolic_number: 19 — fulfillment, culmination of a cycle, awakened awareness
shadow_aspect: Naïveté, ego inflation, denial of shadow
spiritual_meaning: Radiance of the Self in harmony with life
unconscious_connection: Unconscious energy is now aligned with conscious clarity and purpose
journey_theme: Joyful reintegration of the psyche after darkness
jungian_goal: Embodied Self-realization—the joyful union of ego and Self

name: Judgement
archetype: Resurrection, Awakening, Calling, The Final Reckoning
psychological_role: The psyche rises into awareness and integration of its life lessons
ego_status: The ego transcends itself—ready to merge with the total Self
symbolic_number: 20 — rebirth, culmination, unity
shadow_aspect: Guilt, fear of change, fear of being seen, clinging to the past
spiritual_meaning: Answering the soul's true calling
unconscious_connection: The unconscious calls the individual to awaken to a greater identity
journey_theme: Rebirth into truth; the call to integrate all parts of the Self
jungian_goal: Self-judgment becomes self-forgiveness; transformation through awareness and responsibility

name: The World
archetype: The Self, Wholeness, Completion, Integration, Cosmic Union
psychological_role: Represents the complete integration of the conscious and unconscious
ego_status: The ego is now fully aligned with the Self, becoming an integrated whole
symbolic_number: 21 — completion, mastery, transcendence
shadow_aspect: Fear of ending the journey, stagnation, illusion of perfection
spiritual_meaning: Unity with the cosmos, oneness with all things
unconscious_connection: Conscious and unconscious are now in sacred dance, harmonized
journey_theme: Completion of the individuation process
jungian_goal: Attainment of the Self—a full and conscious embodiment of one's true nature
